   Doctors for a Healthy Georgia
   stated on December 2, 2013 in its website:
   "Defensive medicine costs Georgia up to $14 billion a year."

"In Georgia alone, the
   practice of defensive medicine costs up to $14 billion annually."

If the Jackson Healthcare estimate is correct,
   Georgia’s share of annual defensive medicine costs is approximately $19.5
   billion, which is halfway between the estimates in the report cited by
   Oliver.

To sum up, Doctors for a Healthy Georgia said defensive medicine costs
   Georgia up to $14 billion a year.
